intro: Macaranga maluensis, commonly known as the Maluensis mallow, is a flowering plant belonging to the Euphorbiaceae family. It is native to Southeast Asia, including regions of Malaysia and Indonesia. The plant is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered flowers. It thrives in moist, tropical environments and is often found in lowland forests. Its rapid growth and adaptability make it an important species in ecological studies and potential applications in reforestation.
